"'Low'" is a song by American alternative rock band Cracker. It appears on their
1993 album [[Kerosene Hat]].

A number 64 hit on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart in May 1994, its biggest
success was on the rock charts, where the song reached number three on the
Modern Rock Tracks chart in November 1993 and number five on the Mainstream Rock
Tracks chart in March 1994. The music video portrayed lead singer David Lowery
badly losing a boxing match with actress/comedienne Sandra Bernhard.

In 2012, the song was featured in the film [[The Perks of Being a Wallflower
(film)|The Perks of Being a Wallflower]] and its accompanying soundtrack.
